page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF BLOCK
page.content: The block lies to the south of the older part of Middlewich. It remains primarily dairy farming country which is why so much of the land survey shows cultivated grassland. The grass is grown to produce sileage for winter feed. Most of the post war housing development associated with Middlewich lies within the block, and housing estates were being built as the block was being surveyed. The most recent houses are of the small detached type costing in the region of Â£30,000 and most are bought by people moving into the area. In the more rural areas housing development is restricted to modification to existing properties. Although the smaller community at Wimboldsley shares many of the facilities of the larger Middlewich community it retains its individuality with its focus as the village school.
